title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 250.1 - General
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 250.1 - General

State Regulations

Pursuant to article 30-A of the Tax Law, a city having a
population of more than 190,000 but less than 215,000 inhabitants is authorized
to impose a city income tax surcharge on the residents of such city at the rate
prescribed therein. The city income tax surcharge authorized to be imposed
pursuant to article 30-A of the Tax Law is to be administered and collected, including the administration and collection of the income tax surcharge
required to be withheld by employers, by the Department of Taxation and

Finance. Local Law No. 8, as amended by Local Law No. 9, of the City of Yonkers

Laws of 1984 added article IX to the Codes and Ordinances of the City of

Yonkers to impose the city income tax surcharge authorized pursuant to the
authority of article 30-A of the Tax Law, and vested the administration and
collection of such city income tax surcharge with the Department of Taxation
and Finance. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
ยง
250.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
